thread.title: BRIEF-Boeing Reports Q1 GAAP Earnings Per Share Of $4.15

title: BRIEF-Boeing Reports Q1 GAAP Earnings Per Share Of $4.15
text:
April 25 (Reuters) - Boeing Co:
* BOEING REPORTS STRONG FIRST-QUARTER RESULTS; RAISES CASH FLOW AND EPS GUIDANCE
* Q1 NON-GAAP CORE EARNINGS PER SHARE $3.64
* SEES FY EARNINGS PER SHARE $16.40 TO $16.60 * Q1 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $2.58, REVENUE VIEW $22.26 BILLION — THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S
* BOEING - BACKLOG GREW TO $486 BILLION AT QUARTER-END, INCLUDING OVER 5,800 COMMERCIAL AIRCRAFT
* FY2018 EARNINGS PER SHARE VIEW $14.11 — THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S
* BOEING - FULL YEAR CORE EARNINGS PER SHARE GUIDANCE IS INCREASED TO BETWEEN $14.30 AND $14.50 ON PERFORMANCE
* BOEING - FULL YEAR CASH FLOW GUIDANCE IS INCREASED TO BETWEEN $15.0 AND $15.5 BILLION, DRIVEN BY IMPROVED PERFORMANCE
* BOEING - QTRLY FREE CASH FLOW $2,742 MILLION
* BOEING SEES 2018 REVENUE $96.0 BILLION - $98.0 BILLION
* FY2018 REVENUE VIEW $97.36 BILLION — THOMSON REUTERS I/B/E/S
* BOEING QTRLY NET ORDERS WERE $34 BILLION VERSUS $40 BILLION IN Q4 2017
* BOEING - QTRLY COMMERCIAL AIRPLANES REVENUE $13,652 MILLION VERSUS $12,953 MILLION LAST YEAR
* BOEING - REFLECTING STRENGTH OF CARGO MARKET, NOW PLAN TO INCREASE PRODUCTION RATE ON 767 PROGRAM FROM 2.5 TO 3 PER MONTH BEGINNING IN 2020
* BOEING - DEVELOPMENT ON 777X PROGRAM REMAINS ON TRACK
* BOEING - FOR 2018 ABOUT $1.4 BILLION OF PENSION EXPENSE IS EXPECTED TO BE ALLOCATED TO BUSINESS SEGMENTS
* BOEING SEES 2018 COMMERCIAL AIRPLANES DELIVERIES OF 810 TO 815 UNITS
* BOEING SEES 2018 COMMERCIAL AIRPLANES REVENUE OF $59.5 BILLION TO $60.5 BILLION Source text for Eikon: Further company coverage:
